title: Make it so you can't use any mobility spells inside Vegiar's E
body:
Dashes and Blinks are the main thing I'm talking about.
I know they already made it so dashes can't pass, but what about blinks?
Also I was thinking if movespeed boosts would count on this list. (Think Rammus ball, Garen Q), but I'm not sure about it.

replies.body: It already has the unique thing of making people slam their faces into the wall and stop. As a Veigar player, I don't think we need more buffs to make him reliant on his E again.

so for the first 30minutes of the game he does what exactly?.......  take it hard?

The rest of his kit needs work. Not his E.
Making his other spells more reliant on his E only makes it worse IMO

veigar was fine before, he had a short range on his Q and R, making him hit or miss with the stun, and stun mitigation mechanics would  undermine him outright.

now hes  "leave me alone, i need my farm, go away jungler/support roams" 

they shouldn't have touched his Q or E to begin with, they had a "great new idea" with his Q which should've been dumpstered, but they had to give veigars immediate gutting of his E a "its not so bad" overtone, when in reality his Q is more harmful than ever, but still OP in the team setting enough to offset how bad it really is in the earlygame. 


right now his E is just a hey guys, lets focus this area! shot call to the team.
and his W is a "let me hurt the back line just enough to Q 2 of them, miss the third, or for melee minions, just enough damage so that Q damage just wont cut it.

or my favorite, his meteor is just a glorified bush checker.

right now, veigar demands total overhaul, sion grade. because right now hes useless, just ask bjergsen who didn't even consider him a mid laner, (bjerg listed all the mid lane champions, their strengths and weaknesses, said whos good against who, veigar was left out)

How about you stop listening to some of the most stuck up over glorified LCS players. I have outplayed Yasuo's with Veigar. Hell I bring him top lane for lols and still win against people like Xin Zhao. He is strong, but he has one of the highest skill caps in the game because you have to adjust your play style to be dependent on comp as well as time in the game. People underestimate how much a wall that stops all movement can be abused. You can stop a Lee Sin Q/W. You ruin Riven's day. You make LB cry. You make Yasuo wish he could choose the distance he could dash. You can watch Fizz stun himself mid troll pole because he slammed his face into it during the cast animation. The list goes on and on.

The new Veigar is in a much better spot and just needs tiny utility buffs. Yes I played him before and after. I like him both ways, but I like new Veigar better. It's better than going "Kek, I can instant stun and full combo you before you can react and you die instantly"

how about you think for a moment here, and when it comes to any 1v1, i bet on anyone not named veigar, because banshees veil GG veigar just lost the 1v1 against anyone else in all of league.

hes totally team dependent, which is wrong and offers no strength to the team.

if you just unload your whole kit while they have banshee's veil as veigar, then you screwed up.

Poke it off, possibly wait for Q to come back, THEN explode them.

good luck, ill stick by my jungler/support 
or rest of the group.
Not going to be that way forever. Especially if, you know, you work with your team as Fiora.

But there's too much mispotential in his kit for me not to be slightly upset by it. His E should be a tool he can employ, but not something his kit revolves around

He powerfarms. People knock the double Q but I tend to double Q about half of my Q stacks. And if I can't I try to harass with my second hit to help keep them off me. I invest in mana regen and CDR to make sure I have a faster ramp up. 40% CDR means faster AP farm and faster power spike as well as less downtime late game (48s CD ult OP af).

I personally prefer the build which minimizes his weaknesses: {{item:1056}} -> {{item:3028}} -> {{item:3070}} -> {{item:3174}} -> {{item:3158}} -> {{item:3040}} -> {{item:3089}} -> {{item:3135}}/{{item:3157}} ->{{item:3157}} /{{item:3135}}

40% CDR is huge and the mana regen and pool are also major on him. Most people underestimate having double chalice passives (his passive acts like chalice).

I would personally like to see his W being made somewhat easier to hit without landing the stun or relying on it. Like reducing the drop from ~~1.25s~~ -> 1.1s.

with that build, you're planing on late game full 6 items, and team fighting, im not steering you away from that direction, but there are just so many other champions which will abuse you and just try to upset you early game and just get ahead because of it, the enemy mid laner will roam more often, they'll take more dragons, maybe rush a baron, they'll invade your jungle. 

this is ofc, not 100%, but no1 just lets veigar farm. you have to take it, and its pretty damn hard against many other mid laners who just want to kill you. and then ofc, ganks. RIP.

Except that I generally have 600+ AP by 25 minutes. It's not even late game at that point. The point is you can contribute a lot more and your build has more utility in it.  600 AP is enough to make you contribute more than the average mid laner in fights especially with 40% CDR. You get used to sitting back and farming. It isn't that hard, they even buffed his Q range to let him do it more. And building mana regen lets you sit back and do it all game.

I am 19/12 with Veigar in ranked since his rework. I think he is perferctly fine where he is after minor tweaks.

i agree veigar can become a teams source of damage, a full blown powerhouse carry, but he needs a strong front line, and other engage/peel/cc mechanics, and its basically going to be a 4v5 until you get that 600+ AP. 

veigar generally has (bonus) 60AP at 10mins, 170~190 at 20mins, and 280+ at the 30minute mark, this is ofc, you play for maximized AP farm, and get blue buffs, wolves/raptors, etc. 

you cant really break this without snowballing. anything else is behind on farm.
